titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Philadelphia-based ship agency Rice, Unruh, Reynolds Co. For each ship under its management, the company sets the arrival time based on tidal currents, obtains the necessary permission to come into port and arranges for the pilots, tugboats and line handlers. During the 24 hours that a ship is in port, the agents work closely with the Coast Guard and deal with officials at the Customs Border Patrol. They get the ship stored with provisions and spare parts, arrange any repairs that are needed and deal with the medical or dental needs of the seamen on board. If crew members are being repatriated to their homeland, they even arrange for flights home and transportation to the airport.

scopecontent.p: Collection of records of Rice, Unruh, Reynolds Company. Materials include: index of vessels with information on dates of arrival, where from, broker, master, remarks, tugs, and carrying capacity, 1910-1917; booklet with index of vessel names; card file of employees with name, address, nationality, occupation, and age, many of the cards paired with a Water Front Pass which includes a photograph, 1918; and envelopes from Vincent-Mitchell Studios, with identification photographs of employees. Other files include: an index of barges, alphabetically arranged, and include date, master, carrying capacity, and remarks. (1909-1913); cards listing companies and supplies delivered; lists of ships with arrival date, where from, and cargo, 1920-1926; and list of shipping companies, mostly European addresses, 1934-1935.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
